Leonarda predstavljajo izumi
05 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Uredništvo

V Kulturnem domu Gorica bodo drevi ob 18. uri odprli gostujočo razstavo, ki je v tamkajšnjo galerijo pripotovala iz muzeja Stroji Leonarda da Vincija iz Firenc. Obiskovalci si bodo lahko ogledali načrte, modele in makete izumov italijanskega genija, čigar 500-letnico smrti obeležujemo letos.



Razstava načrtov in modelov izumov Leonarda da Vincija 

GORICA > Arhitekt, izumitelj, inženir, kipar in slikar Leonardo da Vinci je eden največjih umov v človeški zgodovini in vodilni nosilec kulturno-umetniškega razcveta v renesansi, enem najplodnejših obdobij svetovne znanosti in umetnosti. Bil je polihistor, vseved brez primere, raziskoval in proučeval je različne vidike umetnosti, znanosti in filozofije svojega časa.
Leonardo da Vinci se je rodil 15. aprila 1452 v toskanski vasici Anchiano blizu Vincija. Pri desetih ali enajstih letih je postal vajenec slavnega slikarja Andree del Verrocchia v Firencah, kjer je deloval tudi v odraslih letih. Pod okriljem mecenov je živel in ustvarjal tudi v Milanu, Benetkah in Rimu. Na povabilo francoskega kralja Franca I. se je na stara leta preselil v Francijo, kjer je leta 1519 tudi umrl.
“Njegove umetnine, kot sta Zadnja večerja in Mona Lisa, so številnim že zelo dolgo dobro znane, njegove tehnične izume pa smo začeli podrobno spoznavati, razumevati in ceniti šele v tem stoletju,” so zapisali v vabilu na otvoritveno slovesnost. Na njej bodo sodelovali goriški pisatelj Giuseppe O. Longo, inženir Gorazd Humar iz Nove Gorice in Gabriele Niccolai, predsednik muzeja Le macchine di Leonardo da Vinci iz Firenc.
Razstava sodi v okvir projekta Leonardo brez meja, ki ga goriški Kulturni dom prireja v skupnem sodelovanju s številnimi partnerji. Na ogled bo do 30. novembra.

Leonard is represented by inventions
05 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Uredništvo

At 18:00 at the Gorizia Cultural Center, the trees will open a visiting exhibition, which arrived from the Stroji Leonardo da Vinci Museum of Florence in the gallery there. Visitors will be able to see the plans, designs and models of the inventions of the Italian genius, whose 500th anniversary is celebrated this year.



Exhibition of plans and models of inventions of Leonardo da Vinci

GORICA> Leonardo da Vinci, an architect, inventor, engineer, sculptor and painter, is one of the greatest minds in human history and a leading carrier of the cultural and artistic boom of the Renaissance, one of the most prolific periods of world science and art. He was a polyhistorian, an unprecedented omen, researching and studying various aspects of the art, science and philosophy of his time.
Leonardo da Vinci was born on April 15, 1452 in the Tuscan village of Anchiano near Vinci. At the age of ten or eleven, he became an apprentice to the famous painter Andrea del Verrocchi in Florence, where he also worked as an adult. He also lived and worked in Milan, Venice and Rome under the auspices of the patrons. At the invitation of the French King Franz I., he moved to France at the old age, where he died in 1519.
"His artworks, such as Last Supper and Mona Lisa, have been well known to many for a long time, and we have only begun to learn, understand and appreciate his technical inventions this century," they wrote in the invitation to the opening ceremony. It will feature the writer from Gorizia Giuseppe O. Longo, engineer Gorazd Humar from Nova Gorica and Gabriele Niccolai, president of the Museum of Le macchine di Leonardo da Vinci from Florence.
The exhibition is part of the Leonardo Without Borders project, organized by the Gorizia Cultural Center in collaboration with many partners. It will be on view until November 30.
